moves.1. d4: QP openings are more geared towards long positional games than quickies. Every now and again, though...
moves.2... e5: Hanauer decides to gamble with the Budapest Gambit.
moves.3. d5: Arnold tries to seize space by declining the Pawn.
moves.3... Bc5: The problem with Arnold's 3rd move is it relinquished control of this square. Hanauer already has a significant advantage in development.
moves.4. Bg5: Trying to gain time by means of a pin. However, Arnold has overlooked a tactical finesse.
moves.4... Ne4: Thunderbolt from heaven! Arnold loses his game-sense and reacts without thinking.
moves.5. Bxd8: The hand is quicker than the mind. Arnold played this move without seeing...
moves.5... Bxf2#: ...this. End of game, and they've barely sat down!
